main event: 1st Lt. A. F. Webb reported observing an unidentified fast moving flame while flying near Denver on January 18, 1950.
interesting points: Seven pilots, including Webb, observed the unidentified object multiple times within 20 seconds., The flame appeared white with a reddish hue towards the rear., Observations were made under clear weather conditions with unlimited visibility., Some pilots reported unusual radio noises at the time of their observations., Investigators could not account for the cause of the observed phenomena.
sighted object: unidentified fast moving flame or light
witness description: military pilots flying in different aircraft near the observation area
